column6: I had a thought that splitting the lectures through 5 days would allow the program to not have to provide food. This is just a thought since I am unaware of all the factors in play.

column7: I was expecting the instructor to cover material in a way that respresents industry standard. For example, here is one way to do this task, but ideally, you want to do this and that because it resembles how you would see it done in the real world.

Do you understand why we have a code of conduct?
Do you understand why you can only work between 15 and 19 hours?
Do you understand that you cannot work more than 7 hours in a day? (PENDING)
Do you understand that you can only work during the week and only with a supervisor present?
Do you understand that you cannot work on weekends?
Do you understand that you cannot work from home or any remote location?
Do you understand that you can be terminated for reasons such as excessive lateness poor attendance and lack of professionalism?
Do you understand that you must set a schedule and set goals with your supervisor for the length of the program?

column8: certain professors were exceptional, but as a whole, my qc experience filled with mostly misses.

column1: ** What did you feel helped you grow the most intellectually?
column8: group collobration is the single greatest component to my learning. You may think you know, but often, a collegue corrects you on something and you will remeber that forever.

column8: Student diversity is high and certain professors are amazing.
